Commonly known as the \u2018Lake District\u2019, Nainital is nestled high up in the Kumaon Himalayas\r at an altitude of around 2,000 m above sea level. This beautiful town in surrounded by seven\r hills, popularly known as \u2018Sapta-Shring\u2019 \u2013 Ayarpata, Deopata, Handi-Bandi, Naina, Alma,\r Lariya-Kanta and Sher-Ka-Danda. The majestic mountains and the sparkling waters of the lake\r add an immense lot to the beauty of the town.  The town is centred around the emerald mountain\r lake Naini, which on most days is dotted with colourful sailboats.",left:" According to mythology, the lake is believed to have been formed when the eyes of goddess \u201CSati\u201D fell at this spot\r while her body was being carried by Lord Shiva after her death.
